pages.text: A staple of early civilizations. $(thing)Earthenware, stoneware and ceramics$() have a variety of uses such as enabling advanced manufacturing, strong materials, storage and decoration.

The ware crafting station is a simple workshop, using an $(item)Artisan Carver$(), it will aid me in working with soft materials, molding and sculpting; however, if I ever want to $(thing)automate$() any of these processes, I should look into a $(item)Turntable$().$(br2)The basic premise of sculpting starts with a full block of material, by carving and smoothing out different segments I can create quality recipients or intricate shapes.

After acquiring the material block, I just have to sculpt it directly with my $(item)carver$() until I get the desired shape, the resulting product should be able to be $(thing)fired$() in a $(l:innovation/burn/kiln)kiln$(). What follows is a list of the different devices I believe I'm able to craft, most of which are made by continuing to work on the previous one.
